note.para: The auxiliary countershaft assemblies CANNOT be installed in the housing with prior installation of the splitter shift yoke.

step1.para: If previously removed, install the bearing inner race on the front of each countershaft ( Figure 305).

figure.caption: Figure 304. Install Bearing Inner Race on Front of Each Countershaft

step1.para: Mark the splitter gear for each countershaft with toolmaker's dye to identify the gear tooth stamped with an "O" for timing purposes ( Figure 306).

figure.caption: Figure 305. Mark Splitter Gear For Each Countershaft

step1.para: Place the left countershaft assembly into position in the housing, meshing the marked tooth of the countershaft splitter gear with either set of two marked teeth of the splitter gear on the output shaft ( Figure 307). DO NOT INSTALL REAR BEARING AT THIS TIME.

figure.caption: Figure 306. Place Left Countershaft Assembly into Position

step1.para: Repeat the previous procedure with the right countershaft assembly, meshing the marked tooth of the countershaft splitter gear with the remaining set of two marked teeth of the splitter gear on the output shaft ( Figure 308). DO NOT INSTALL REAR BEARING AT THIS TIME.

figure.caption: Figure 307. Place Right Countershaft Assembly into Position
